restaurant.name: Koshaa
restaurant.description: Experience the rich flavors of traditional Indian cuisine, crafted with love and authentic spices.

seo.title: Koshaa - Authentic Indian Restaurant in Ontario
seo.description: Experience authentic Indian cuisine at Koshaa. Fresh ingredients, traditional recipes, and exceptional service in the heart of Ontario.
seo.keywords: Indian restaurant, authentic Indian food, Ontario restaurant, Indian cuisine, curry, tandoori, biryani

about.title: Our Story
about.subtitle: The people, place, and philosophy behind Koshaa

restaurant.heading: Koshaa Fine Indian Cuisine
restaurant.intro: At Koshaa, we aspire to bring authentic traditional Indian flavors to the heart of the Parklawn–Lakeshore area. Our aim is to serve dishes that pay homage to India's rich cultural history, with a focus on exquisite Indian delicacies and exceptional service in a contemporary, family-friendly setting. As enthusiastic food connoisseurs, we believe in curating every dish to perfection.

koshaaMeaning.intro: 'Koshaa' is derived from Sanskrit and describes five layers of the body:
koshaaMeaning.philosophy: In ancient teachings, each Koshaa brings a person to complete awareness of their true self. Our hope is that through the experience of our food we take you on a similar journey—peeling the layers that speak to your palate until you reach flavorsome bliss.

restaurant.menuNote: Our menu is curated to bring the authenticity of Indian cuisine to your table, freshly prepared every day using high-quality local ingredients.

chef.heading: Meet the Chef
chef.name: Ushmeet
chef.imageAlt: Ushmeet, Executive Chef and Co-Owner of Koshaa
chef.intro: With more than 10 years of full-time experience in the food industry, Ushmeet is the executive chef and co-owner of the restaurant.
chef.career: He started his career as a chef at Hilton hotels in India and has since served as Head Chef at various hotels and restaurants in Toronto, including a well-known Indian restaurant on the Danforth and in the Entertainment District.
chef.education: Ushmeet has studied food as part of his graduation and post-graduation. He is a hospitality graduate from the International Institute of Hotel Management in India and holds a post-graduation in Culinary Management from George Brown College in Toronto, which equipped him with a deep understanding of the Canadian food industry and culture.

testimonials.name: Sarah Johnson
testimonials.text: The butter chicken is absolutely divine! Best Indian food I've had in Ontario. The staff is incredibly welcoming and the atmosphere is perfect.

testimonials.name: Michael Chen
testimonials.text: Authentic flavors that remind me of my travels in India. The biryani is perfectly spiced and the naan is always fresh. Highly recommend!

testimonials.name: Priya Patel
testimonials.text: Finally found a place that makes authentic Indian food! The spice levels are perfect and they accommodate dietary restrictions well.
